content: ok, we're in the slide to publication. From now on, no changes to schema/structures at all. Changes to narrative content still allowed
Any time still available, or is this it?
Freeze is on now. Anyone still wants to make changes to make the ballot, need to discuss them with me first
ok. Freeze is off. Anyone can commit anything, but what ever you commit has missed the boat for ballot/baltimore
the ballot/connectathon version is on the branch stu3-ballot
I am relieved to be doing that on schedule. This has been a long sprint for the finishing line
Great stuff everyone, and a really big thank you to @Grahame Grieve !!!

Fantastic! Thanks to everyone (but especially @Grahame Grieve) for the hard work on this push.

(Now, who wants to make a wager about the number of ballot comments or commenters we'll see?)
but actually, the difference analysis is really interesting... we have some real stability now. So it might not be more...
I accidentally made the branch for stu3-ballot at the build directory, not the root. Not quite what I meant to do, but I think that's ok. let me know ASAP (or even before then) if that's a problem

@Grahame Grieve I would like to clone the git branch for STU3-ballot to translate the specification and publish to http://fhir-ru.github.io/ (our Russian translation of FHIR which at the moment looks at https://github.com/hl7-fhir/fhir-svn master branch), where can I find the branch for STU3-ballot version of FHIR?

Hi @Aleksandra Pavlyshina, the source is in SVN, not GIT. the Sept 2016 ballot snapshot is here: http://gforge.hl7.org/svn/fhir/stu3-ballot. (We accidentally created it against "root" instead of under "svn/tags" as we normally would.)
